341

344

351

355

356

357

History...

358

359

360

361

362

363

365

366

367

368
00:28:58,360 --> 00:29:02,080

fucking... What are we gonna do?

369

370

I'm telling you, man, it's over.

371

372

379

388

"Driving Mr. Lenny."

391

392

402

414

415

416

417

421
00:31:34,120 --> 00:31:36,960

422

423

424
00:31:48,680 --> 00:31:50,120

- Strickland.

425
00:31:50,320 --> 00:31:51,560

426

427

428

429

430

431

432

433
00:32:10,760 --> 00:32:12,240
Mr. Fumitsu.

434

Leonard Nero,

435
00:32:18,560 --> 00:32:22,000

436
00:32:22,240 --> 00:32:25,240

440

441
00:32:39,640 --> 00:32:41,280
Good evening, Mr. Fumitsu.

442
00:32:41,480 --> 00:32:43,280

443

447

- No.

448

449

452

453

454
00:33:32,200 --> 00:33:34,040

455
00:33:34,280 --> 00:33:35,480

456
00:33:35,680 --> 00:33:39,280

457

459
00:33:55,320 --> 00:33:57,600

478

479
00:35:11,600 --> 00:35:14,320

480

481

482

483

484

You understand me?

485
00:35:26,320 --> 00:35:30,880
I got a child, I got rent,

486
00:35:31,080 --> 00:35:34,920

I'm just trying to hold on here.

487
00:35:36,040 --> 00:35:39,120

488
00:35:39,360 --> 00:35:41,320

- You get out with Fumitsu.

489
00:35:41,520 --> 00:35:43,240

490
00:35:46,960 --> 00:35:50,120
I'll get you there in 10 minutes, sir.
I'm sorry.

491
00:35:50,320 --> 00:35:51,960
I'm changing my plans.

492
00:35:52,200 --> 00:35:56,000
Your supervisor has recommended an
excellent club, the Retinal Fetish.

493
00:35:56,240 --> 00:35:57,760
I believe it's on La Cienega.

494
00:35:57,960 --> 00:35:59,400
Yes, sir.

495
00:36:08,080 --> 00:36:09,040
Enjoy your evening.

496
00:36:09,280 --> 00:36:12,360
Hey, Mace, I really appreciate it.
Thank you.

497
00:36:15,200 --> 00:36:16,680
Excuse us.

498
00:36:22,760 --> 00:36:24,720
- Hi, Lenny.
- This is Mr. Fumitsu.

499
00:36:24,920 --> 00:36:26,880
Take care of him.
Show him a good time.

500
00:36:27,080 --> 00:36:29,640
John, can you take care
of this gentleman?

501
00:36:31,880 --> 00:36:33,960
Hey. Bye.

502
00:37:33,520 --> 00:37:34,480
How you doing?

503
00:37:34,680 --> 00:37:36,680
Who's the side of beef
in Gant's posse?

504
00:37:37,000 --> 00:37:38,320
Oh, that's Wade Beemer.

505
00:37:38,520 --> 00:37:41,160
He was a running back
for the Rams in '96 and '97.

506
00:37:41,360 --> 00:37:42,880
Hit like a freight train.

507
00:37:46,920 --> 00:37:49,680
- Rams, that's football, right?
- No, it's Ping-Pong.

508
00:37:49,880 --> 00:37:51,640
Hey, Iris was looking for you.

509
00:37:58,360 --> 00:37:59,600
Hello, Lenny.

510
00:38:00,000 --> 00:38:03,720
It's okay, Wade, he's an old friend
of mine. Lenny Nero.

511
00:38:05,440 --> 00:38:07,680
Come to peddle clips
for old time's sake...

512
00:38:07,880 --> 00:38:10,000
...or making extra bucks
for the holidays?

513
00:38:10,240 --> 00:38:13,760
You're not a client. I wouldn't sell
you the sweat off a dog's balls.

514
00:38:14,280 --> 00:38:16,920
I already got everything I need
from you, thanks.

515
00:38:17,960 --> 00:38:19,720
Cut it out, Philo.

516
00:38:20,240 --> 00:38:24,120
Too bad about Jeriko. Tough break.
You've lost your golden goose.

517
00:38:24,320 --> 00:38:27,320
Try showing some respect.
He was an important artist.

518
00:38:27,520 --> 00:38:30,560
Important for your label,
which is why you're in mourning.

519
00:38:30,760 --> 00:38:34,240
His records will sell out
now he's dead. You'll make out.

520
00:38:34,600 --> 00:38:35,880
Always do.

521
00:38:36,080 --> 00:38:38,880
Faith, can I talk to you
for one second?

522
00:38:39,080 --> 00:38:41,720
It's not a good idea right now, Lenny.

523
00:38:41,920 --> 00:38:43,800
I gotta talk to you for one second.

524
00:38:44,000 --> 00:38:47,440
- About what?
- That would be between me and Faith.

525
00:38:50,200 --> 00:38:52,760
Funny, I don't feel anything
between you and her.

526
00:38:53,200 --> 00:38:56,600
You see, that's your problem, Lenny.

527
00:38:56,800 --> 00:38:59,680
You assume there's something
where there's nothing.

528
00:38:59,880 --> 00:39:02,200
You assume that you have a life.

529
00:39:02,400 --> 00:39:05,760
In fact, you're just peddling
pieces of other people's lives...

530
00:39:05,960 --> 00:39:08,800
...and the broken parts of your own.

531
00:39:09,320 --> 00:39:10,320
Faith.

532
00:39:10,520 --> 00:39:13,680
- Wade, get him to his car.
- Call me. Faith, call me, okay?

533
00:39:14,360 --> 00:39:16,800
Faith! Call me!

534
00:39:17,760 --> 00:39:19,000
Lenny the Loser.

535
00:39:19,240 --> 00:39:23,000
- Leave him alone, Philo, okay?
- You shouldn't be talking to him.

536
00:39:23,240 --> 00:39:26,400
You shouldn't talk to anybody.
Not with all that's going on.

537
00:39:26,600 --> 00:39:30,000
You are too goddamned paranoid,
you know that?

538
00:39:30,400 --> 00:39:34,960
Paranoia's just reality
on a finer scale.

539
00:39:38,360 --> 00:39:39,520
Thank you.

540
00:40:24,600 --> 00:40:26,600
- What up, Tex?
- What's up, my brother?

541
00:40:27,960 --> 00:40:30,000
Those rascals still
haven't grown back?

542
00:40:30,200 --> 00:40:32,040
No. Any day now.
I just know it.

543
00:40:32,640 --> 00:40:34,000
I got something for you.

544
00:40:34,200 --> 00:40:37,280
It's a present.
Something I had custom made.

545
00:40:37,960 --> 00:40:39,400
Happy Millennium.

546
00:40:40,880 --> 00:40:43,840
I got something for you too.
It just showed up tonight.

547
00:40:44,760 --> 00:40:46,800
I don't know who from.

548
00:40:48,640 --> 00:40:50,080
"Fan mail from some flounder?"

549
00:41:20,600 --> 00:41:22,640
- Hi.
- Hi.

550
00:44:05,560 --> 00:44:06,680
Hi, baby.

551
00:44:07,560 --> 00:44:08,840
I missed you.

552
00:44:09,640 --> 00:44:11,640
Lenny, you have to leave.
I mean it.

553
00:44:11,840 --> 00:44:14,600
Iris said you're in trouble.
What did she mean?

554
00:44:14,800 --> 00:44:17,200
- You talked to Iris? When?
- Tonight.

555
00:44:17,400 --> 00:44:20,560
I haven't seen her in months.
What the fuck would she know?

556
00:44:20,760 --> 00:44:24,240
- Who knows what's in her head?
- She used to be your best friend.

557
00:44:24,440 --> 00:44:25,800
What, Iris?

558
00:44:26,000 --> 00:44:28,840
You're really running out
of excuses to come around.

559
00:44:29,040 --> 00:44:31,520
I know you, Faith.
You're afraid of something.

560
00:44:31,720 --> 00:44:33,760
- What's going on?
- Let it alone, Lenny.

561
00:44:33,960 --> 00:44:36,000
- It'll take care of itself.
- It's Gant.

562
00:44:36,400 --> 00:44:38,080
This guy is poison. Listen to me.

563
00:44:38,320 --> 00:44:40,920
He's got you walled in.
He uses the wire too much.

564
00:44:41,160 --> 00:44:43,240
He gets off on tape, not on you.

565
00:44:43,440 --> 00:44:46,000
That's a good one, coming from you.

566
00:44:46,440 --> 00:44:48,960
- Why don't you just split?
- I don't want to.

567
00:44:49,160 --> 00:44:50,440
What, you love him?

568
00:44:51,400 --> 00:44:53,960
I don't think so.
To him, you're just a possession.

569
00:44:54,200 --> 00:44:58,560
You're like a Ferrari,
just something to show the other guys.

570
00:44:59,480 --> 00:45:02,160
Yeah? He has his uses too, you know.

571
00:45:02,360 --> 00:45:03,360
What?

572
00:45:04,000 --> 00:45:06,720
- He gonna record you on his label?
- He might.

573
00:45:07,240 --> 00:45:09,000
You never know, right?

574
00:45:12,880 --> 00:45:16,680
Listen to me. I've watched you
create yourself out of nothing.

575
00:45:16,880 --> 00:45:20,360
You're like a goddamn cruise missile
targeted on making it.

576
00:45:20,560 --> 00:45:21,960
And you will.

577
00:45:22,360 --> 00:45:23,880
I know I will.

578
00:45:24,840 --> 00:45:29,040
It's you up on that stage.
It's not him. You don't need him.

579
00:45:32,080 --> 00:45:35,360
You have to get out.
If Philo catches you, he'll hurt you.

580
00:45:35,560 --> 00:45:37,440
- I'm already hurting.
- I'm serious.

581
00:45:37,640 --> 00:45:40,960
He's acting crazy.
He's doing way too much playback.

582
00:45:41,280 --> 00:45:43,400
He's gotten completely paranoid.

583
00:45:43,600 --> 00:45:47,280
He's such a control freak, he's even
paying Max to follow me around.

584
00:45:47,480 --> 00:45:49,080
Max? You're kidding!

585
00:45:49,360 --> 00:45:50,800
Yeah, for about a month now.

586
00:45:52,200 --> 00:45:53,480
Jesus.

587
00:45:54,080 --> 00:45:57,120
Look, Lenny,
just stay away from Philo.

588
00:45:57,320 --> 00:45:58,680
And stay away from me.

589
00:45:58,880 --> 00:46:00,240
Stop trying to rescue me.

590
00:46:00,440 --> 00:46:03,440
Those days are over.
I'm a big girl now. I've changed.

591
00:46:03,640 --> 00:46:07,680
Stop trying to save me. I don't
need saving. Just give up on me!

592
00:46:09,440 --> 00:46:12,360
I just wanted to make sure
you were all right.

593
00:46:14,880 --> 00:46:18,480
You know one of the ways that movies
are still better than playback?

594
00:46:19,200 --> 00:46:22,440
Because the music comes up,
there's credits...

595
00:46:22,640 --> 00:46:24,880
...and you always know when it's over.

596
00:46:25,960 --> 00:46:27,040
It's over!

597
00:46:30,160 --> 00:46:31,400
You were great.

598
00:46:38,240 --> 00:46:40,800
Hey, man, I know what you're thinking.

599
00:46:41,280 --> 00:46:42,720
You should have told me.

600
00:46:42,920 --> 00:46:44,560
I was gonna. It's just a job.

601
00:46:44,760 --> 00:46:47,000
- I feel like shit about it.
- You should.

602
00:46:47,240 --> 00:46:50,240
I do feel like shit.
You introduced me to that prick Gant.

603
00:46:50,440 --> 00:46:52,880
I introduced him to Faith too.
Not a good move.

604
00:46:53,080 --> 00:46:56,720
Questionable move, definitely,
given the historical perspective.

605
00:46:56,920 --> 00:47:00,320
I take the prick's money...
You wouldn't believe what I charge...

606
00:47:00,520 --> 00:47:03,360
- and I make sure that Faith
is okay at the same time.

607
00:47:03,560 --> 00:47:05,720
I keep an eye on her for you, okay?

608
00:47:05,920 --> 00:47:10,640
Which you can't do without getting
your fingers bent the wrong way back.

609
00:47:11,480 --> 00:47:14,280
I need the money.
This way, it does us both some good.

610
00:47:14,480 --> 00:47:16,920
Fairly twisted logic, Max.
Even for you.

611
00:47:17,720 --> 00:47:19,840
- Hey, you got a job.
- I got a job.

612
00:47:20,160 --> 00:47:22,960
Okay, I'm sorry.
You got a job. That's great!

613
00:47:24,480 --> 00:47:26,440
Listen, you've gotta stay on her.

614
00:47:26,640 --> 00:47:28,640
- Watch her for me, please.
- I'm on her.

615
00:47:29,280 --> 00:47:31,560
- Okay.
- Be cool. Take care.

616
00:47:31,840 --> 00:47:33,320
- Take it easy.
- You too.

617
00:47:42,440 --> 00:47:44,160
Here, chicky, chicky, chicky...

618
00:47:44,360 --> 00:47:45,880
Hey, wait a minute!

619
00:47:46,080 --> 00:47:49,080
I recognize you.
You're Wade Beemer, right?

620
00:47:49,320 --> 00:47:52,960
Running back for the Rams, '96, '97.
Am I right?

621
00:47:53,440 --> 00:47:54,960
Yeah, that's right.

622
00:47:55,200 --> 00:47:57,680
I saw you play, man.
You were good. Really good.

623
00:47:57,880 --> 00:48:00,040
I mean, like a fucking freight train.

624
00:48:00,280 --> 00:48:02,880
So, what happened? Injuries or what?

625
00:48:03,560 --> 00:48:05,640
- Bullshit politics.
- It's always politics.

626
00:48:05,840 --> 00:48:08,840
Like this thing here.
He's paying you to tune me up.

627
00:48:09,040 --> 00:48:10,520
I could pay you more not to.

628
00:48:10,720 --> 00:48:14,080
- I could write you a check right now...
- I gotta go.

629
00:48:14,320 --> 00:48:17,520
Okay, cash! Cash!
Here's everything I have on me.

630
00:48:17,720 --> 00:48:20,800
Oh, look! What do you say?
How about a Rolex?

631
00:48:22,560 --> 00:48:24,080
I got a real one.

632
00:48:24,680 --> 00:48:26,040
It won't hurt too bad.

633
00:48:26,800 --> 00:48:30,440
- It's nothing personal, all right?
- Just one second, please.

634
00:48:32,600 --> 00:48:35,720
It's my jacket.
It's really expensive.

635
00:48:36,640 --> 00:48:38,280
Just not the eyes.

636
00:48:51,760 --> 00:48:52,720
You're bleeding.

637
00:48:53,040 --> 00:48:55,440
Some jerk puked on the stairs
and I slipped.

638
00:48:55,640 --> 00:48:58,080
I should sue. You came back for me.

639
00:48:58,440 --> 00:49:00,960
I came back to pick up my client.

640
00:49:01,160 --> 00:49:02,520
No, you came back for me.

641
00:49:03,560 --> 00:49:06,200
I gotta lie down, Macey.
Please, in the back?

642
00:49:25,720 --> 00:49:28,200
You're some piece of work, Lenny Nero.

643
00:49:28,760 --> 00:49:31,560
You calmly backstroke along
in the big toilet bowl...

644
00:49:31,760 --> 00:49:34,280
...and somehow you never
let it touch you.

645
00:49:34,920 --> 00:49:38,360
Between working vice and your
current so-called occupation...

646
00:49:38,560 --> 00:49:41,320
...you must've seen
every kind of perversion.

647
00:49:41,520 --> 00:49:44,600
But you're just like some Teflon Man.

648
00:49:44,800 --> 00:49:48,800
You still come out
this goofball romantic.

649
00:49:49,640 --> 00:49:52,200
It's my sword and my shield, Macey.

650
00:50:02,760 --> 00:50:05,600
All right, a little B&E action.

651
00:50:05,800 --> 00:50:07,520
- What did you say?
- Oh, nothing.

652
00:51:44,720 --> 00:51:45,880
Shit.

653
00:52:01,520 --> 00:52:03,560
Please. Please.

654
00:52:04,240 --> 00:52:07,320
Please, you can let me go.

655
00:52:07,520 --> 00:52:10,600
Please. I haven't seen your face.

656
00:52:12,280 --> 00:52:15,320
Let me go. Let me go, please!

657
00:52:15,520 --> 00:52:17,560
Oh, my...

658
00:52:21,840 --> 00:52:22,920
Lenny.

659
00:52:23,680 --> 00:52:24,640
Lenny!

660
00:52:26,160 --> 00:52:30,440
Go to the Sunset Regent right now.
Go! Go!

661
00:52:49,720 --> 00:52:51,720
He's jacking it into his own output.

662
00:52:52,240 --> 00:52:53,760
She's seeing what he's seeing.

663
00:52:54,440 --> 00:52:56,960
She's seeing herself.

664
00:54:03,520 --> 00:54:06,080
Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

665
00:54:50,640 --> 00:54:52,760
Lenny. What is it?

666
00:54:53,440 --> 00:54:54,600
Black-jack.

667
00:54:54,880 --> 00:54:56,160
Black-jack?

668
00:54:56,600 --> 00:54:58,320
Snuff clip.

669
00:54:59,800 --> 00:55:01,200
It was Iris.

670
00:55:01,560 --> 00:55:04,960
- Sick fucker killed her.
- Are you sure it's real?

671
00:55:40,360 --> 00:55:41,720
Oh, shit.

672
00:56:06,480 --> 00:56:08,320
Well, I've lost my appetite.

673
00:56:09,000 --> 00:56:10,680
For about a year.

674
00:56:14,840 --> 00:56:17,920
- Want to take a look?
- Hell, no. I don't fool with that.

675
00:56:21,280 --> 00:56:22,960
- You all right?
- Yeah.

676
00:56:23,480 --> 00:56:26,000
- You okay?
- No, not really.

677
00:56:28,960 --> 00:56:30,080
All right.

678
00:56:30,600 --> 00:56:31,760
Let's work it.

679
00:56:32,080 --> 00:56:34,240
No, I can't.

680
00:56:34,800 --> 00:56:37,280
Come on, Lenny.
You used to be good at this shit.

681
00:56:37,480 --> 00:56:40,320
- Play it down. What's the perp doing?
- I can't.

682
00:56:40,520 --> 00:56:43,600
You used to be a fucking cop.
That's a fucking murder.

683
00:56:45,640 --> 00:56:48,200
- What's he doing?
- Okay. He stalks her.

684
00:56:51,200 --> 00:56:53,600
He rapes her. And he does her.

685
00:56:53,800 --> 00:56:56,800
He records it. It's a thrill kill.
He wants to see it again.

686
00:56:57,000 --> 00:56:59,920
He records himself raping
and killing her.

687
00:57:00,120 --> 00:57:03,440
- And he sends the signal to her.
- So she feels what he feels...

688
00:57:03,640 --> 00:57:04,800
...while he's inside her.

689
00:57:05,000 --> 00:57:08,440
The thrill while he's killing her
is sent to her...

690
00:57:08,640 --> 00:57:11,760
...heightening her fear,
which heightens the turn-on for him.

691
00:57:15,240 --> 00:57:18,120
- I've seen a lot.
- So have I. Too much.

692
00:57:18,360 --> 00:57:20,160
It's a bad one. It's a bad one.

693
00:57:23,200 --> 00:57:26,560
He makes her see her own death,
feeds off the reaction.

694
00:57:26,880 --> 00:57:29,040
He records it all. Everything.

695
00:57:29,240 --> 00:57:30,560
And gives it to you.

696
00:57:30,760 --> 00:57:32,760
Yeah, he wants to share.

697
00:57:32,960 --> 00:57:35,960
Of course he wants to share, man.
That's his deal.

698
00:57:36,160 --> 00:57:38,840
He needs an audience.
This is a sick puppy.

699
00:57:39,040 --> 00:57:41,840
- Why me?
- Because you're the Magic Man, Lenny.

700
00:57:42,400 --> 00:57:44,120
You make dreams happen, don't you?

701
00:57:44,360 --> 00:57:47,840
If it has to do with the wire,
eventually it washes up on your beach.

702
00:57:48,040 --> 00:57:51,920
I've never dealt in black-jacks.
Never. Everybody knows that.

703
00:57:52,200 --> 00:57:55,640
He's skull-fucking you.
He wants to get a reaction out of you.

704
00:57:55,880 --> 00:57:59,000
He wants to make you do something
you do not want to do.

705
00:57:59,200 --> 00:58:03,000
Maybe he just figures Lenny
will appreciate what he's created.

706
00:58:03,200 --> 00:58:05,320
It's the dark end of the street.
You like it?

707
00:58:05,520 --> 00:58:06,960
Jesus, Mace. Back off.

708
00:58:07,160 --> 00:58:10,160
This guy is one of your
squid-head contacts.

709
00:58:10,400 --> 00:58:13,560
- He's somebody that you know.
- Problem with that is...

710
00:58:13,760 --> 00:58:15,920
...Lenny knows everybody.

711
00:58:16,120 --> 00:58:17,320
Take it to the cops.

712
00:58:17,520 --> 00:58:18,440
No.

713
00:58:21,160 --> 00:58:22,400
They'll crucify me.

714
00:58:22,600 --> 00:58:26,680
I see, so this wire-freak
gets to keep running around, huh?

715
00:58:26,880 --> 00:58:29,320
He's right.
They'll think he's the perp.

716
00:58:29,520 --> 00:58:32,240
Or they'll go through his
client list and ruin his life...

717
00:58:33,320 --> 00:58:34,400
...such as it is.

718
00:58:35,520 --> 00:58:39,960
I'll call my buds in Homicide, say she
was a friend. They'll keep me posted.

719
00:58:40,160 --> 00:58:42,760
I'll get me the forensics
and all that shit, okay?

720
00:58:42,960 --> 00:58:45,320
I'll call you when I get something.

721
00:58:45,520 --> 00:58:46,880
Relax.

722
00:58:50,560 --> 00:58:54,040
Keep moving, man. Somebody's thinking
about you a whole lot.

723
00:59:30,040 --> 00:59:31,560
Leave me alone.

724
00:59:33,160 --> 00:59:35,960
Don't come to my house.
Are you trying to ruin my life?

725
00:59:36,160 --> 00:59:38,600
Iris is dead. She was murdered.

726
00:59:43,000 --> 00:59:45,280
- Who did it?
- I don't know, but he's damaged.

727
00:59:45,480 --> 00:59:47,880
Iris said you were in danger.

728
00:59:48,080 --> 00:59:49,160
I'm not in danger.

729
00:59:49,400 --> 00:59:51,560
No more games.
Whatever you're hiding...

730
00:59:51,760 --> 00:59:53,880
...you have to get out of here now.

731
00:59:54,080 --> 00:59:55,240
Come with me now.

732
00:59:55,480 --> 00:59:57,360
Then what? Will you protect me?

733
00:59:57,560 --> 00:59:59,960
Big tough guy.
You're a fucking talker.

734
01:00:00,160 --> 01:00:01,600
You don't even own a gun.

735
01:00:01,800 --> 01:00:03,280
I do. It's under my bed.

736

- Tell me.

737
01:00:12,440 --> 01:00:13,640

738

739
01:00:16,560 --> 01:00:20,680
Listen, listen. Lenny just stopped

740
01:00:20,880 --> 01:00:24,000

Remember Iris?

741

742

Charm.

743

Tell you what, Lenny...

744
01:00:30,240 --> 01:00:33,600
...just for you, make you a deal.
Why don't you just take her?

745
01:00:34,880 --> 01:00:37,480
If she's so unhappy and wants to,

746
01:00:37,680 --> 01:00:41,440
I'll let her decide.
Faith always knows what she wants.

747
01:00:41,640 --> 01:00:43,240
Don't you, Faith?

748
01:00:43,880 --> 01:00:45,080
Hands off.

749

Tell you something else.

750
01:00:49,240 --> 01:00:50,880
I'll tell you this, you fuck:

751
01:00:51,080 --> 01:00:54,400
If she says she stays, you go.

752
01:00:54,600 --> 01:00:59,440
You crawl back in your cockroach hole
and never cross my vision again.

753
01:01:07,920 --> 01:01:08,840
Come on.

754
01:01:23,480 --> 01:01:25,640
I've made my choice, Lenny.

755
01:01:31,640 --> 01:01:33,080
Get him out.

756
01:01:33,680 --> 01:01:35,080
Get him out.

757
01:01:36,080 --> 01:01:39,600
Fucking crazy, Faith!
You're fucking crazy!

758
01:01:45,360 --> 01:01:48,040
I don't love you anymore.
Do you understand that?

759
01:01:48,240 --> 01:01:53,040
You mean nothing to me.
Leave me alone, Lenny, please.

760
01:01:57,440 --> 01:02:00,200
You said you were gonna
get Iris out of this.

761
01:02:00,440 --> 01:02:02,480
Now you understand
the danger we're in.

762

So sweet what you said out there.
So touching, I almost believed it.

763
01:02:07,080 --> 01:02:10,280
I don't think he even understands
that you did it for him, right?

764
01:02:10,480 --> 01:02:13,440
He doesn't know what's going on.
Leave him alone!

765
01:02:13,640 --> 01:02:17,800
I'd love to, if he'd stop coming
around and you'd stop talking to him.

766
01:02:21,560 --> 01:02:26,280
The only time a whore should open
her mouth is when she's giving head.

767
01:02:34,960 --> 01:02:36,280
This is your floor.

768
01:02:36,520 --> 01:02:37,560
Just go.

769
01:02:38,000 --> 01:02:41,760
- Guess who's going to the hospital?
- Can we be smart here?

770
01:02:41,960 --> 01:02:44,160
I could make it worth your while.

771
01:02:45,600 --> 01:02:48,840
I'm not saying you don't land

772

Here, look. Take my Rolex.

773

Nice watch.

774
01:02:55,080 --> 01:02:57,000

- Sure.

775
01:02:58,680 --> 01:03:00,360
You stupid piece of shit.

776
01:03:01,120 --> 01:03:02,680
You stupid fuck, get up!

777
01:03:03,200 --> 01:03:04,560
Come on, get up!

778

779

780
01:03:22,120 --> 01:03:24,120
It was short notice.

781
01:03:25,160 --> 01:03:26,880

782

783
01:04:01,360 --> 01:04:03,720
Come on. Let's go.

784

785

That's fucked up.

786

787

788

789

790

Cops are lazy, and they know

791
01:04:30,120 --> 01:04:32,280

792

793

794
01:04:37,280 --> 01:04:39,120

795

- No, it doesn't.

796

That's not random.

797

If they get me, I know...

798

799

Which means this whole random

800
01:04:54,760 --> 01:04:56,160
They whacked her for a reason.

801
01:04:56,560 --> 01:04:58,200
So the guy's not a psycho?

802

803

804

Put that down.
I'll check on you tomorrow.

805

You want to rub my neck?

806

Shoulder's real sore.

807

- Yeah.

808

809

810

812

813

814

815

816

817

818

In front of your own son!

819

- A child loves you for a long time.
Not just to play with, loves you.

820

821

- Hi.

822

823

Last day of the world,

824

825

826

827

828

829

830

831

832

833
01:07:26,120 --> 01:07:28,560

834

No worries, bro. I gotta jam.

835

836

837

838

839

840

841

847

That is one unbelievable

849

851

852

854

855

857

858

She was just here, man.

859

860

861

862

863

She wouldn't let me see it.

864

865

Like insurance.

866

867

868

869

870

871

Damn. I'm boxed in.

872
01:13:37,280 --> 01:13:38,480

873

Nothing.

874

875

878

879

881

882

892

894

895

896
01:17:46,600 --> 01:17:48,240

897

898

Get in here, Lenny.
Come on, move it. Move!

899
01:18:20,240 --> 01:18:22,040

900
01:18:22,240 --> 01:18:25,200
Just kick out hard
and follow me, okay?

901

902

903

905
01:19:02,520 --> 01:19:05,480
Me and Faith in a hot tub

906
01:19:08,080 --> 01:19:09,720

907

908

Well, you got me missing the party

909

Like I ain't

910

911

913

916

917

918

Come on, Zander.
We're going for a ride.

919

- Get in the car.

920

921

Yo, what's up?

922

Yo, Mace! What's up?

923

924

925

- Watch the fireworks.

926

927

You've gotta see it.

928

929

930

931

932

933

934

Thank you, Jeriko.

935
01:22:31,200 --> 01:22:35,080
Oh, I'll take you home.

936

- That's right.

937
01:22:37,560 --> 01:22:40,120

938

939

Lights, damn. Look at this, man.

942

948

950

952

Goddamn, man. What the hell

953

954
01:23:48,560 --> 01:23:52,240

955

956

957

959

962

963

I'm that 800-pound gorilla

965

966

967

Jeriko One?

You're the one getting all

976
01:24:57,120 --> 01:24:59,560
It's gonna be called "Robo-Steckler."

977
01:25:00,600 --> 01:25:03,400
It's all about a cop who met
his worst nightmare:

978
01:25:03,600 --> 01:25:07,960
A nigga with enough political juice
to squash his ass like a stink bug.

979
01:25:08,200 --> 01:25:09,920
You're gonna be famous, fucker.

980
01:25:10,120 --> 01:25:11,760
I don't think so.

981
01:25:15,040 --> 01:25:16,760
Stop that bitch!

982
01:25:21,760 --> 01:25:23,080
Get her!

983
01:25:38,640 --> 01:25:39,760
Get her!

984
01:26:04,400 --> 01:26:05,640
Oh, God!

985
01:26:07,840 --> 01:26:08,920
Hang on. Hang on, Max.

986
01:26:13,600 --> 01:26:14,560
You see?

987
01:26:17,600 --> 01:26:18,560
You had to see it.

988
01:26:19,640 --> 01:26:22,840
I see the world opening up
and swallowing us all.

989
01:26:23,280 --> 01:26:24,760
Yeah, I know.

990
01:26:26,680 --> 01:26:28,080
Max, are you there?

991
01:26:28,600 --> 01:26:31,720
Meet me at Tick's in a half-hour.
And, Lenny...

992
01:26:31,960 --> 01:26:33,120
...don't get pulled over.

993
01:26:34,960 --> 01:26:37,520
You know what this tape could do
if it gets out?

994
01:26:39,120 --> 01:26:40,680
Yeah, I've got a pretty good idea.

995
01:26:41,280 --> 01:26:43,080
People finding out...

996
01:26:44,000 --> 01:26:45,400
...seeing...

997
01:26:46,600 --> 01:26:50,480
...that the LAPD just flat out
executed Jeriko One.

998
01:26:51,480 --> 01:26:52,960
Jesus.

999
01:26:54,400 --> 01:26:55,880
Jesus.

1000
01:26:57,560 --> 01:26:59,640
Maybe they ought to see.

1001
01:27:00,680 --> 01:27:01,480
Maybe.

1002
01:27:02,040 --> 01:27:04,280
But tonight is probably not
the best night.

1003
01:27:13,840 --> 01:27:14,960
Come on.

1004
01:27:15,640 --> 01:27:16,840
We're rolling.

1005
01:27:25,120 --> 01:27:28,840
Those cops didn't do Iris. Whoever
Iris was wearing for killed her.

1006
01:27:29,080 --> 01:27:30,280
Why?

1007
01:27:30,520 --> 01:27:31,560
To break the trail.

1008
01:27:31,800 --> 01:27:34,520
If those cops had gotten hold of her,
they'd know who she was wearing for...

1009
01:27:34,720 --> 01:27:36,200
...and then gone after them too.

1010
01:27:36,960 --> 01:27:39,520
Our killer is running as scared
as we are.

1011
01:27:39,880 --> 01:27:43,080
Which makes him really dangerous,
judging by how scared I am.

1012
01:28:13,440 --> 01:28:15,080
Sounds like Tick's already
celebrating.

1013
01:28:15,320 --> 01:28:16,880
You seem a little overdressed
for this party.

1014
01:28:17,120 --> 01:28:19,080
I want to look nice for you, Lenny.

1015
01:28:20,640 --> 01:28:23,200
Tick, I gotta talk to you.

1016
01:28:27,680 --> 01:28:29,000
Shit.

1017
01:28:42,000 --> 01:28:43,160
He's been cooked-off.

1018
01:28:45,360 --> 01:28:47,640
- Is he dead?
- No, but his frontal lobes...

1019
01:28:47,880 --> 01:28:49,080
...are like runny eggs.

1020
01:28:49,320 --> 01:28:52,640
They put an amplifier in-line
to boost the signal...

1021
01:28:52,880 --> 01:28:53,960
...and fried his brain.

1022
01:28:57,840 --> 01:28:58,760
It's Lenny.

1023
01:28:59,320 --> 01:29:00,720
Tick, come on!

1024
01:29:05,840 --> 01:29:06,920
Come on!

1025
01:29:07,840 --> 01:29:10,120
Come on, Tick, come on!

1026
01:29:11,480 --> 01:29:13,440
He's totally cut off from
the outside world.

1027
01:29:13,680 --> 01:29:14,840
How long does it last?

1028
01:29:16,120 --> 01:29:17,120
Forever.

1029
01:29:18,640 --> 01:29:20,960
Those two psycho cops are on
a slash-and-burn...

1030
01:29:21,200 --> 01:29:23,520
...to find the tape and cover
their tracks.

1031
01:29:24,440 --> 01:29:28,960
They want to find out what Tick knows.
If there are copies, who wired Iris.

1032
01:29:29,200 --> 01:29:31,160
It won't get investigated
as a homicide...

1033
01:29:31,440 --> 01:29:33,160
...since he's technically alive.

1034
01:29:33,400 --> 01:29:35,240
That's right. He's technically alive.

1035
01:29:35,480 --> 01:29:38,200
Seems sophisticated for them.
They're not subtle.

1036
01:29:38,480 --> 01:29:40,360
There's more to this than you think.

1037
01:29:40,600 --> 01:29:41,560
What do you mean?

1038
01:29:43,560 --> 01:29:47,880
All I'm saying is, you don't know how
high up the food chain this goes.

1039
01:29:48,400 --> 01:29:50,400
- I've heard stuff.
- What stuff?

1040
01:29:50,640 --> 01:29:53,960
You know, I heard stuff. Smoke.
Rumors. I've heard stuff.

1041
01:29:54,920 --> 01:29:57,160
I've heard stuff about a death squad.

1042
01:29:58,360 --> 01:30:02,400
A group of guys, cops, loyal
to the hard-line school.

1043
01:30:02,680 --> 01:30:05,560
Guys that've had too many years
of city hall...

1044
01:30:05,800 --> 01:30:08,840
...review boards and the media
pissing down their necks...

1045
01:30:09,080 --> 01:30:11,480
...suspending cops right and left,
tying their hands...

1046
01:30:11,720 --> 01:30:14,440
...while out of the other side of
their mouths, these people...

1047
01:30:14,680 --> 01:30:17,400
...are squealing, "Save us!
Do something, you fucking morons...

1048
01:30:17,640 --> 01:30:19,640
...crime is totally out of control."

1049
01:30:23,800 --> 01:30:25,360
Bullshit. It's conspiracy paranoia.

1050
01:30:25,600 --> 01:30:28,160
The issue isn't whether
you're paranoid.

1051
01:30:28,400 --> 01:30:30,440
The issue is whether you're
paranoid enough.

1052
01:30:30,720 --> 01:30:32,440
Christ!

1053
01:30:32,680 --> 01:30:34,480
Exactly. Get religion, man.

1054
01:30:34,720 --> 01:30:36,280
I love you like my own blood...

1055
01:30:36,560 --> 01:30:38,680
...but don't walk near me
in public, okay?

1056
01:30:39,000 --> 01:30:41,160
The only card we got to play
is the tape.

1057
01:30:41,440 --> 01:30:42,320
Get it to the media.

1058
01:30:42,600 --> 01:30:44,000
Yeah, right, blow it open.

1059
01:30:44,280 --> 01:30:47,160
No disrespect, but if it's
the 11:00 news, by midnight...

1060
01:30:47,360 --> 01:30:49,560
...you got the biggest riot
in history.

1061
01:30:49,800 --> 01:30:52,760
So you're saying we just pretend
it didn't happen?

1062
01:30:52,960 --> 01:30:53,720
I didn't say that.

1063
01:30:54,000 --> 01:30:57,600
The LAPD executed one of the
most important black men in America.

1064
01:30:58,800 --> 01:31:00,440
Who the fuck are you to bury it?

1065
01:31:00,640 --> 01:31:03,800
Trying to rake the LAPD over
a cheesegrater?

1066
01:31:04,240 --> 01:31:07,280
Fine. Do you want blood running
waist-deep in the storm drains?

1067
01:31:07,560 --> 01:31:12,240
Gangbangers'll spread like a wave
and burn this city to the ground.

1068
01:31:12,520 --> 01:31:16,000
When the fires start, the cops will
cap off anything that moves.

1069
01:31:16,560 --> 01:31:18,200
It'll be all-out war and you know it.

1070
01:31:18,440 --> 01:31:19,520
I don't think so.

1071
01:31:20,000 --> 01:31:21,640
Well, maybe it's time for a war!

1072
01:31:21,880 --> 01:31:23,440
You really want that on your head?

1073
01:31:25,640 --> 01:31:26,720
Really?

1074
01:31:29,160 --> 01:31:32,520
Whoever did Iris did Tick.
It's the same sick wirehead shit.

1075
01:31:32,760 --> 01:31:34,800
Same reason, to burn the trail.

1076
01:31:35,040 --> 01:31:38,440
If Faith knows anything about this,
and she does...

1077
01:31:38,680 --> 01:31:40,400
Somebody's gonna kill Faith?

1078
01:32:36,160 --> 01:32:38,720
Jesus! You scared the fuck out of me.

1079
01:32:39,160 --> 01:32:40,280
What do you want?

1080
01:32:40,560 --> 01:32:43,040
We know about Jeriko.
Iris made me a copy of the tape.

1081
01:32:43,320 --> 01:32:46,120
Goddamn it. I was trying to
keep you out of this.

1082
01:32:46,320 --> 01:32:47,520
I know. How did it happen?

1083
01:32:47,800 --> 01:32:50,360
What was Iris doing riding around
with Jeriko, wearing a wire?

1084
01:32:50,600 --> 01:32:52,760
Faith, listen. Look at me!

1085
01:32:53,040 --> 01:32:55,680
You gotta trust us, we're here
to help you.

1086
01:32:57,480 --> 01:32:59,120
All right, I'll talk to you alone.

1087
01:32:59,320 --> 01:33:01,040
- Mace is in this.
- Tell us.

1088
01:33:08,080 --> 01:33:10,960
Philo's gotten obsessed with playback.

1089
01:33:11,640 --> 01:33:13,120
He's a total wiretrip junkie.

1090
01:33:14,000 --> 01:33:17,040
He's such a control freak,
he's having people followed.

1091
01:33:17,320 --> 01:33:19,560
He's recording his business
partners' calls.

1092
01:33:19,800 --> 01:33:21,440
He's wiring up people left and right.

1093
01:33:23,240 --> 01:33:26,760
Philo and Jeriko didn't get along.
He thought Jeriko might dump him...

1094
01:33:27,040 --> 01:33:30,000
...but he wasn't sure, so he started
with the surveillance.

1095
01:33:30,280 --> 01:33:32,680
A couple nights ago, he wires up Iris.

1096
01:33:32,960 --> 01:33:37,080
He sends her and the other girl,
Diamanda, over to Jeriko's table.

1097
01:33:40,360 --> 01:33:44,320
Hi, baby. My name's Iris.

1098
01:33:46,840 --> 01:33:48,600
I've got a present for you.

1099
01:33:49,520 --> 01:33:50,920
You're so beautiful.

1100
01:33:52,640 --> 01:33:56,600
So that night, Iris calls up crying.
She's freaking out.

1101
01:33:56,840 --> 01:33:58,800
She comes over and plays the tape.

1102
01:33:59,040 --> 01:34:00,760
Philo loses it.

1103
01:34:01,040 --> 01:34:02,960
He can't believe what
a disaster it is.

1104
01:34:03,480 --> 01:34:06,600
He's afraid the cops will beat it out
of her who she's been working for...

1105
01:34:06,800 --> 01:34:08,760
...and come looking for him.

1106
01:34:12,120 --> 01:34:13,960
Why not go public and save himself?

1107
01:34:14,200 --> 01:34:16,920
If it got out that he had his own
artists under surveillance...

1108
01:34:17,160 --> 01:34:19,960
...he'd lose all his other acts and
it'd be over for him.

1109
01:34:41,960 --> 01:34:44,000
So he gave Iris some money...

1110
01:34:44,240 --> 01:34:47,120
...and tells her to check into
a hotel under an assumed name...

1111
01:34:47,360 --> 01:34:49,000
...so he can figure out what to do.

1112
01:34:49,240 --> 01:34:50,640
He figured out what to do all right.

1113
01:34:51,160 --> 01:34:52,320
You think he killed her?

1114
01:34:52,640 --> 01:34:54,520
The killer knew where she was.

1115
01:34:57,000 --> 01:34:58,480
What a nightmare.

1116
01:34:58,760 --> 01:35:02,240
I don't know where the fuck she is,
but we're late. Let's go.

1117
01:35:02,720 --> 01:35:05,120
Listen, how do you want me
to work tonight?

1118
01:35:05,360 --> 01:35:08,240
At the Bonaventure, you want me
at the party or the suite?

1119
01:35:09,880 --> 01:35:11,520
Leave here with me, right now.

1120
01:35:14,600 --> 01:35:15,280
Come on.

1121
01:35:15,560 --> 01:35:17,040
- We talk later.
- I need to know.

1122
01:35:17,240 --> 01:35:18,960
Upstairs, downstairs,
where will you be?

1123
01:35:19,160 --> 01:35:21,800
Go get her, go!

1124
01:35:23,560 --> 01:35:25,520
I just say things once, baby, so...

1125
01:35:25,760 --> 01:35:28,200
...we'll talk about that later.

1126
01:35:28,480 --> 01:35:30,760
Okay, man. I'm cool, I'm sorry.

1127
01:35:31,000 --> 01:35:33,560
Wait. Go for a pass, bro.

1128
01:35:54,920 --> 01:35:55,840
Shit!

1129
01:35:56,080 --> 01:35:57,720
Go! Out of my fucking way!

1130
01:35:59,800 --> 01:36:01,680
Come on!

1131
01:36:03,760 --> 01:36:05,560
Go! Go!

1132
01:36:07,480 --> 01:36:09,400
Pardon me! Sorry, sorry!

1133
01:36:09,760 --> 01:36:11,720
Get out of my fucking way!
Move it!

1134
01:36:11,960 --> 01:36:12,840
Move!

1135
01:36:16,200 --> 01:36:17,200
You're finished!

1136
01:36:20,280 --> 01:36:22,840
Let's go, darling, walk with me.
Happy New Year!

1137
01:36:33,960 --> 01:36:35,280
Get out of the way!

1138
01:36:35,560 --> 01:36:36,800
Excuse me!

1139
01:36:37,080 --> 01:36:38,320
Out of my fucking way!

1140
01:36:42,240 --> 01:36:44,880
Not now, baby.

1141
01:36:46,240 --> 01:36:47,480
Not here.

1142
01:37:25,960 --> 01:37:28,400
Well, I'm certainly in the mood
for a party.

1143
01:37:28,640 --> 01:37:31,840
- Wait. I'll take her up to the suite.
- No problem.

1144
01:37:32,280 --> 01:37:34,160
You'll have a glass of champagne...

1145
01:37:34,880 --> 01:37:36,280
...or six.

1146
01:37:36,560 --> 01:37:39,280
I'll be up in a bit to help you
ring in the New Year.

1147
01:37:43,160 --> 01:37:45,080
I live for the moment.

1148
01:37:45,880 --> 01:37:48,080
Pussy-whipped,
sorry-ass motherfucker.

1149
01:37:50,720 --> 01:37:52,280
Take it easy.

1150
01:37:52,600 --> 01:37:53,720
So where are they now?

1151
01:37:54,000 --> 01:37:56,280
He's got her up in the room,
under guard.

1152
01:37:56,720 --> 01:37:58,800
And he's still working the party...

1153
01:37:59,040 --> 01:38:01,520
...acting smooth like
nothing's nothing.

1154
01:38:01,800 --> 01:38:04,160
So, buddy, I say we work a trade.

1155
01:38:04,440 --> 01:38:05,520
- What do you mean?
- Give him the clip.

1156
01:38:05,760 --> 01:38:09,880
It's brilliant. The tape for Faith.
He'll go for it, I can set it up.

1157
01:38:10,160 --> 01:38:13,040
This is what we laughingly refer
to as a plan, right?

1158
01:38:13,240 --> 01:38:15,040
Just get your butt down here.

1159
01:38:15,280 --> 01:38:19,400
If I'm not at the party downstairs, go
to the room. It's 2203. You writing?

1160
01:38:19,640 --> 01:38:22,600
2-2-0-3.

1161
01:38:22,880 --> 01:38:26,080
If he gives us any shit,
we kill them all.

1162
01:38:26,320 --> 01:38:28,440
What do you say?
Release him to the pigeons.

1163
01:38:29,560 --> 01:38:31,440
Okay, we got to get over there.

1164
01:38:32,120 --> 01:38:35,320
- Can you borrow a dress from Cecile?
- I'm not going.

1165
01:38:36,280 --> 01:38:38,200
We're going! Gant'll do her...

1166
01:38:38,480 --> 01:38:39,880
Shut up.

1167
01:38:40,120 --> 01:38:41,840
Park your mouth and listen.

1168
01:38:42,160 --> 01:38:44,040
It's a setup. Think about it!

1169
01:38:44,240 --> 01:38:47,400
Why send you the tapes?
Get you to rush in without thinking?

1170
01:38:47,680 --> 01:38:50,680
Put a bullet in you, one in her,
put the gun in your hand?

1171
01:38:51,040 --> 01:38:52,520
That sounds right.

1172
01:38:52,760 --> 01:38:53,680
I'm going.

1173
01:38:54,320 --> 01:38:56,640
You'll get yourself killed for this?

1174
01:38:57,040 --> 01:38:59,080
For this toxic-waste bitch!

1175
01:38:59,320 --> 01:39:01,080
What the fuck are you doing?!

1176
01:39:06,000 --> 01:39:09,280
This is your life!
Right here, right now.

1177
01:39:09,560 --> 01:39:12,800
This is real time, you hear me?
Real time!

1178
01:39:13,080 --> 01:39:14,480
Time to get real. No playback.

1179
01:39:14,880 --> 01:39:16,520
You understand me?

1180
01:39:17,000 --> 01:39:18,640
She doesn't love you anymore.

1181
01:39:18,880 --> 01:39:21,520
Maybe she did once, I don't know,
but she doesn't now.

1182
01:39:22,000 --> 01:39:26,440
These are used emotions.
It's time to trade them in.

1183
01:39:27,160 --> 01:39:30,040
Lenny, memories were meant to fade.

1184
01:39:30,680 --> 01:39:32,960
They're designed that way
for a reason.

1185
01:39:36,480 --> 01:39:38,640
Have you ever been in love with...

1186
01:39:39,360 --> 01:39:41,760
...someone who didn't return
that love?

1187
01:39:43,760 --> 01:39:45,080
Yeah, Lenny.

1188
01:39:46,360 --> 01:39:47,680
I have.

1189
01:39:50,160 --> 01:39:52,360
It didn't stop you from loving them,
right?

1190
01:39:52,600 --> 01:39:57,720
Or being able to understand them,
or forgive them?

1191
01:39:59,200 --> 01:40:00,760
I guess.

1192
01:40:02,160 --> 01:40:04,720
Didn't stop you from wanting
to protect them.

1193
01:40:05,760 --> 01:40:06,680
Did it?

1194
01:40:15,440 --> 01:40:18,080
When I met Faith she was just
another...

1195
01:40:18,560 --> 01:40:20,280
...another runaway...

1196
01:40:20,560 --> 01:40:23,440
...giving $20 blowjobs
to buy crank.

1197
01:40:24,800 --> 01:40:27,240
Another lost soul.

1198
01:40:28,800 --> 01:40:31,760
And she had this voice.

1199
01:40:32,920 --> 01:40:34,320
It was scary.

1200
01:40:36,120 --> 01:40:39,560
Like she could take all the hurt
and rage of the entire world...

1201
01:40:39,800 --> 01:40:42,360
...and lift it up to heaven
in one voice.

1202
01:40:43,680 --> 01:40:45,320
I helped her.

1203
01:40:46,480 --> 01:40:50,160
And I promised her that I'd always
just be there...

1204
01:40:50,720 --> 01:40:52,120
...to protect her.

1205
01:40:55,000 --> 01:40:58,640
It's not about what's in her head.
It's what's in mine.

1206
01:40:59,800 --> 01:41:02,080
I can't let go of the promise.

1207
01:41:03,160 --> 01:41:05,960
It's like, it's all I have left.

1208
01:41:16,600 --> 01:41:18,160
No, it's not.

1209
01:41:30,680 --> 01:41:31,800
Come on.

1210
01:41:33,440 --> 01:41:35,000
Let's go to a party.

1211
01:42:51,960 --> 01:42:52,760
Shit!

1212
01:42:54,360 --> 01:42:55,680
Let's bail.

1213
01:43:04,680 --> 01:43:06,960
You look great in that dress.

1214
01:43:07,520 --> 01:43:08,520
Better than I would.

1215
01:43:09,560 --> 01:43:11,120
Thank you. I think.

1216
01:43:11,480 --> 01:43:12,400
Come on, let's go!

1217
01:43:37,440 --> 01:43:40,000
How do we get into
the biggest party in history?

1218
01:43:40,200 --> 01:43:43,000
Relax, Mace, this is what I do.

1219
01:44:02,320 --> 01:44:03,640
You see Gant?

1220
01:44:13,600 --> 01:44:14,520
Shit.

1221
01:44:25,080 --> 01:44:27,800
Come on, Max. Come on, buddy.

1222
01:44:30,680 --> 01:44:34,200
Your call is unavailable or
has traveled...

1223
01:44:34,440 --> 01:44:36,800
I still got one ace to play.

1224
01:44:37,040 --> 01:44:39,080
Gant's got what I want
